intro: Ononis salzmanniana var. simulata, commonly known as the Salzmann’s everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial with small, needle-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its scientific name reflects its close relationship to the species Ononis salzmanniana.
